page.title: 03ARCHITECTURE
page.content: Most housing in Hardwick is very new.Over the years Hardwick has expanded in size and in population, so there have been many new houses built. Houses are made of brick and timber frames.Houses have windows and doors sometimes they also have a porch.The bricks are a mucky brown.Most people live in them have young children.When the houses are nearly finshed the builders paint them.Prices are aprox 46.000 pounds for four bedroomed house.Hardwick was in the first domesday book.There was a school which was built in 1871 for a cost of 452 pounds.When the school packed up it became a house.Other buildings in the old village date back to the first domsday book and are stone built with thatched roofs. These include the old blacksmiths forge and the bakery.
